channel.title: Pi a server sided noclip command?
channel.description:
ok so my client started with a noclip command but it has that thing like when you .zip or .rar it or idk somewwre along the road everything in client sided client.java looks like this [code]/* if(inputString.equals("::noclip")) { [/code] ha well you cant see it there but there are all these little squares everywere and it looks all messy.
so does anybody have a noclip command for pi that can be put in commands.java??? rep + if you help me

item.title: Pi a server sided noclip command?
item.dc:creator: @deans1243 deans1243
item.description:
@deans1243 wrote:

yea i tried that when i paste it in notepad++ and save or save as it saves as a regular notepad file with the encoding…
so i just have to figure out how to take the encoding out. this will only be for the client i have tho not for other players can anybody help me with it??

Read full topic
item.source: Pi a server sided noclip command?

item.title: Pi a server sided noclip command?
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

You can copy and paste into the Notepad++ file and it won’ t turn back into blocks (ie encoding). You can do anything that you would normally do in notepad in notepad++. Then just compile and your done, simple really.

Read full topic
item.source: Pi a server sided noclip command?

item.description:
@deans1243 wrote:

item.title: Pi a server sided noclip command?
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

No-clip is added client-sided, not server-sided.

And the squares are because of the encoding.
Just use Notepad++ or and IDE.

Read full topic
